Description: Almond-shaped artificial eye in stone. Black pigments marking the iris located in the middle of the piece and faint traces along the edge. Brown stains at the front, and black ones at the back. The front is convex, while the back is flat. The eye would have originally been placed on the orbit of a mummified individual.
Curator's comments: Published in: P.H.K. Gray, 'Artificial eyes in mummies', JEA 57 (1971) , pl. XXXIV (2nd row, first from the left of fig. 1)
